name: Jaydeb Sarker
content: Jaydeb Sarker Jaydeb Sarker Assistant Professor in CS at UNO © I am a Tenure Track Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at University of Nebraska at Omaha. I obtained my Ph.D. (2024) and MS (2022) in Computer Science at Wayne State University (WSU) . At WSU, I worked in Software Engineering Analytics Lab (SEAL) under the supervision of Dr. Amiangshu Bosu. My research interest lies in Human Factors Software Engineering, Empirical Software Engineering, Natural Language Processing, and Human-Computer Interaction. My research works have been published in Top Tier SE venues, including FSE, TOSEM, ASE, and ESEM. Dr. Jaydeb Sarker is the director of the COACH lab at UNO. For more details, visit COACH Lab . [Prospective Ph.D. Student] If you are interested in pursuing a PhD in Computing & Information Science at UNO, look the program details here. Application Deadline is: January 15, 2026. Preferred qualifications include an MS in CS or a related field and prior research experience. If you are interested in working in my research lab in Software Engineering, Human Aspects of SE, and NLP, please send an email to me with your CV and unofficial transcript. You can find here for the UNO graduate admission policy and transcript evaluation for international students. Without a complete application on the UNO system, prospective applicants will not be evaluated for potential candidacy. May 08, 2024: Successfully defended my Ph.D. in Computer Science!!! Having a doctorate !!!!!!! April 2024: Accepted the Tenure Track Assistant Professor Offer from the University of Nebraska Omaha in Computer Science April 2024: Selected for the Outstanding Graduate Teaching Assistant Award by the CS Department at WSU !!!
